channel.title: Prelude of the Chambered (A Mojang production?)
channel.description:
It was posted on Notch's twitter, but its under a contest entry (Id48). All I have done is obtain the JAR and made a frame for it for easier offline play. Please note, this is 100% Mojang code except for the 'com.mojang.escape.EscapeFrame' class is my own.
Sources: http://twitter.com/#!/notch/ (Notch's twitter) https://s3.amazonaws.com/ld48/index.html (Applet page I obtained it from)
Download: http://up.ht/pYrRBA

item.title: Prelude of the Chambered (A Mojang production?)

@mironic wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:11, topic:411535”]I will look into this but it seems the levels are generated from an image.[/quote]derp.

item.title: Prelude of the Chambered (A Mojang production?)
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

The source was released on the LD48 competition page, but if you run com.mojang.escape.EscapeComponent, it will create a JFrame and attach the component to it

The worlds largest online game jam event. Join us every April, August, and December.

item.title: Prelude of the Chambered (A Mojang production?)
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:9, topic:411535”]That yellow ghost was a bitch. I got 3/4 keys and 11/12 trinkets.
What happens when you get all 4 keys?[/quote]you get to see soo the word “you win” when you walk through the last door
12/12 trinkets is impossible since one is stuck in between a rock

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ratbagmasta ratbagmasta
item.description:
@ratbagmasta wrote:

Pretty fun game, although i couldn’t escape that maze with the ghosts all over, and the yellow ghost kicked my ass really bad. A continue function would be nice.

Been reading up on it and apparently Notch programmed this over a 48 hour period on a live stream.

item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:3, topic:411535”]I thought it was very different myself. Just seems Notch can’t break away from the whole ‘blocks’ idea.[/quote] he had “48” hours to think of somethign and post, he had no time to think of a new concept XD
